title: BBC Local Live: Nottinghamshire on Wednesday 28 December 2016 - BBC News
summary: dog missing for two months found 50 miles away in newark .
benidorm death 'covered up ' , says brother of tourist .
a52 petition extended to new year .
panthers beat steelers twice in two days .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: that 's all from local live today .
join us again tomorrow , from 08:00 .

documents.title: virgin trains east coast have fifth oldest carriages
text: i told you earlier about the average age of east midlands trains ' rolling stock - 24 years .
well virgin trains east coast , who also run trains in nottinghamshire , have even older carriages - at 30 years .
they have the fifth oldest carriages in the country out of 20 operators , according to the figures from the office of rail and road .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : 'nowhere but nottingham ' for mcclure 's first play
text: you 'll probably know her best from this is england or line of duty but nottingham 's bafta award-winning vicky mcclure has never tread the boards before .
until now she 's performing in touched , at the playhouse , early next year .
and she says she did n't want to perform anywhere but nottingham .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

text: latest headlines for nottinghamshire

documents.title: could nottingham get a dog pub ?
text: `` in a year that has shaken the world , i feel we could all do with a good pint and a good dog , '' says budding nottingham entrepreneur adam firth .
the hospitality professional has launched a kickstarter campaign in a bid to open a doggy pub .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: forest vs newcastle : who 's in and out ?
text: midfielder ben osborn 's knee injury is not serious - he could face newcastle on friday but will be assessed tomorrow .
forest have an injury doubt over joe worrall ahead of the game at newcastle .
kasami has recovered from illness but mancienne is suspended .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: weather : fog warning
text: it 's another cold night with some mist and dense patches of freezing fog reforming .
as such the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for fog valid from 17:00 until 12:00 tomorrow .
whilst the fog will be patchy , in some areas visibility could be less than 100m .
there is also the risk of ice forming on some untreated surfaces , so do take extra care , especially out on the roads .
minimum temperature : -1c ( 30f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: 'emotional reunion ' for casey and owners
text: here 's another pic of casey , the wandering border collie .
the dog wardens had a bit of an audience in the supermarket car park as they skillfully rescued him from close to the train line near newark castle station .
alan batty added they still have no idea how he ended up in newark
`` we had one relieved and emotional owner who could n't wait to collect him from us .
it was a very emotional reunion for dog and owners when they went into his kennel , '' he said .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: runaway casey 'scared , tired and thin '
text: there had been a few sightings of casey since he disappeared in october but , due to his very nervous nature , no-one could catch him .
his owners set up a facebook page but it was n't until newark and sherwood district council 's dog warden team were called into action that he was returned on 21 december .
alan batty , from the council 's dog warden service , said they had to act calmly so as not spook the dog .
`` no sooner said than done , between them they had caught one very scared , tired and thin dog . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dog missing for two months found 50 miles away
text: this is casey the border collie , who disappeared two months ago in spilsby , near skegness .
amazingly he 's been reunited with his owner after turning up 50 miles away in the car park of waitrose in newark !
luckily casey was microchipped and dog wardens were able to return him after supermarket staff reported spotting a dog in the bushes near the rail lines .
i love it when a tail has a happy ending ( sorry ) .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how old is your train ?
text: get the train to work ?
ever wondered how old the carriage might be as it trundles along ?
well if you travel using east midlands trains , the average age is 24 - three years older than the national average .
campaigners say the figures from the press association show train quality is a `` postcode lottery '' but the government says it is rolling out new carriages .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: no response from spanish police
text: the inquest , in nottingham last october , heard it was probable the head injuries alan rankin sustained were consistent with an assault , rather than simply being caused by the fall from the cliff top .
but the coroner said it was n't clear if he died from the fall or was assaulted .

mr rankin said he wanted to warn tourists , who might be visiting over the festive period : `` it wo n't bring my brother back , but i do n't want this to happen to other innocent victims , '' he said .
the bbc has contacted the spanish police but we 've not yet had a response .
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News Online

documents.title: brother 's death 'was covered up '
text: `` benidorm is a dangerous place to visit , partly due to the bad press the british have there , '' david rankin said .
`` noisy crowds of british tourists are often kicked out of pubs and clubs and are mishandled by the bouncers whilst the spanish police look on . ''
he said his brother - who was 75 - could not have climbed the cliffs as he had a history of mobility issues and his wallet was missing when he was found .
`` alan 's death was covered up by the spanish police , because benidorm is a popular british tourist destination and they want to protect their means of income . ''
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News Online

documents.title: benidorm 'dangerous ' says brother of dead tourist
text: the brother of a man who died in benidorm two years ago has been telling us the spanish resort is `` dangerous '' for holidaymakers .
alan rankin ( from west bridgford , was found dead at the bottom of a cliff in october 2014 .
an inquest in the uk found his head injuries were likely to have been caused by an assault and the nottingham coroner recorded an open verdict .
david rankin , 72 , believes his brother 's death was not accidental and blames spanish police for `` mishandling '' british tourists .
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News Online

documents.title: hardy : 'lawyers back at it '
text: alan hardy tweeted last night about things moving closer with the notts county buy-out deal
lawyers and accountants back at it today trying to get comfortable with the numbers .
hopefully it can be sorted out in the next 24 hours !
@ twitterid @ twitterid assuming it all goes through , are there funds to sort this mess out in jan ?
in freefall !
sort the mess out alan and then hopefully once the dust settles you can come and join in a few nottscountygolfsociety matches
@ twitterid @ twitterid very best of luck to you alan .
if enthusiasm was a barometer for success , you 're well on the right road .

not doubting you at all but what can you do that rt could n't do given the amount of £ he 's invested ?

comfortable ?

author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: what happened in a52 crash ?
text: gurdip singh kareer , 41 , and 22-year-old kyle o'connor , both from wollaton , died after a collision involving two cars and a lorry .
there were lane closures on the road for more than 24 hours after the crash on 25 november .
two men , aged 22 and 24 , were arrested and bailed over the crash .
mr smith , who 's going door to door gathering signatures , said he hoped to present the petition to parliament in the new year .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : a60 roadworks
text: roadworks on the a60 mansfield road in ravenshead are causing slow traffic at the kighill lane junction .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: a52 petition extended to next year
text: you might remember back in november , after two men died in a crash on the a52 , a petition was started to bring in safety measures along the bramcote stretch .
now the petition is being extended into the new year .
resident tony smith , who started the petition , said : `` you more or less take your life in your own hands sometimes . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: panthers beat sheffield twice in two days
text: new signing jason williams scored his second game-winning goal in as many days as nottingham panthers made it two wins out of two over sheffield steelers during the festive period .
after boxing day 's 3-2 victory in sheffield , panthers repeated the scoreline at the national ice centre .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: hardy could finalise magpies buy-out in 24 hours
text: prospective notts county owner alan hardy has suggested the fine print of the deal to buy the club may be completed by tomorrow .
hardy has hinted that the numbers could be sorted out within 24 hours .
it comes after notts lost their seventh straight league game 1-0 to doncaster rovers on boxing day .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport
